gov.usgs.anss.util

Class ErrorTrack

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.util.ErrorTrack

  • public static class ErrorTrack
extends java.lang.Object
    This class helps with creating a "error" variable which is used in "chk***()" routines from FUtil. This class tracks how many errors are found between reset() and errorCount(). The FUtil routines (or the any user chkForm) records an error and appends some text using appendText(). At the end of the error checking routine (usually chkForm in the GUI) the ErrorTrack is used to see if any errors where found with isSet() and the text of all the errors obtained for display by getText(). Typical use would be ErrorTrack err = new ErrorTrack(); err.reset(); d = FUtil.chkDouble(textField1, err); dt = FUtil.chkDate(textField2, err); if(err.isSet()) { Take action saying the form did not check out. Note : FUtil is designed to change the color of invalid fields to red when the text fields cannot convert.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
